metadata.title: CVE-2019-11696 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Files with the .JNLP extension used for "Java web start" applications arenot treated as executable content for download prompts even though they canbe executed if Java is installed on the local system. This could allowusers to mistakenly launch an executable binary locally. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
